page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The villages of Aston Rowant,Kingston Blount,Crowell and Chinnor lie along the base of the Chiltern Escarpment, bounded by the Upper and Lower Icknield Ways.The land surrounding these vilages is agricultural but mechanisation has greatly reduced the number of people involved. The villages are no longer inhabited by those earning their living from the land and allied trades.The motorway enables those working in London and other nearby industrial areas to live in these villages. The pace of life,compared with the towns,is slower and lacks anonimity but the community is no longer drawn together by common necessity or achieveme.The rural environment is so attractive that the communities,especially in Chinnor continue to expand.
